sect1.title: Working with Service Call Statistics
sect1.para: Service call Statistics typically deals with questions such as:

listitem.para: What was/is the total load on our system?
What services were called when, how often, by whom?
What was the performance of the system, i.e. the response time to these services?
Have the been errors while processing the service calls? How many? When?

sect1.para: The Service Call Statistics flavor is ideally suited for answering those questions. It can be initiated by
sect1.itemizedlist:
choosing appropriate log files in the Log File Selection Dialog (see ). Such log files typically contain one or more log lines per service call, which contain a time stamp, the name of the service, the response time, and optionally the user who invoked the service and a return code.
choosing a log parser configuration with a Service Calls and Response Times Parser Type.
pressing the Apply button.

sect2.title: The service call statistics panel
sect2.para: A service statistics panel will appear. An example is schon in . The panel lists all the services that have been called together with some important statistical numbers. All these numbers consider the full observation time period of all monitored log files. They are:

listitem.para: Shows how many times a specific service was called in total.

Show the number of service calls of a specific service that returned with an error code.
This column is only displayed if the active log parser configuration contains a Value representing "OK". See .
The number of service calls, divided by the observation period, i.e. the mean number of service calls per minute.
The mean response times. Calculated as the sum of all response times divided by the number of service calls.

The median of the response times. Half of the observed service call took longer, half of them took shorter to respond than this value. The median is less sensitive to extreme values than the mean response time: A few service calls with very long response times can lead to elevated mean response times, but have less influence onto the median.
The 90% percentile of the response times. 10% of all service calls took shorter than this value to respond.

sect2.para: The row named "total" considers all service calls. The rows that are labeled with a service name represent the statistics of a specific service.

A user can interact with the service call statistics panel in various ways. By clicking a row in the service table, he can bring up a Service Call Detail window will pop up and show the individual service calls. One by row. See .

The right half of the service statistics table is used for the configuration of a service scatter plot: The checkboxes define what details will be shown in the plot. The meanings of the checkboxes are:

listitem.para: When enabled, every service single service call of a specific service is represented by a dot.
When enabled, a line which represents the number of service calls per second is displayed. This average value will be calculated once per minute.
When enabled, a line representing the mean response times (per minute) is displayed.
When enabled, a line representing the median response times (evaluated once per minute) is displayed.

sect2.para: The color column allows the assignment of specific colors to specific services. When clicked, a color chooser dialog is brought up. The Statistics Magnification Factors allows an artificial steepening of the "Mean" and "Median" lines by multiplying the according values with a factor. This can be useful, when those lines are hard to see behind the dots of the scatter plots.
